--- title: "Graphic design" date: "2024-06-03" date_end: "2024-06-07" --- ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 5 in *The Truthful Art* [@Cairo:2016] - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 4](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/color-basics.html) and [Chapter 27](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/image-file-formats.html) in *Fundamentals of Data Visualization* [@Wilke:2018] - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Cédric Scherer, ["Colors and emotions in data visualization"](https://www.storytellingwithdata.com/blog/2021/6/8/colors-and-emotions-in-data-visualization) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Lisa Charlotte Muth, ["Emphasize what you want readers to see with colors"](https://blog.datawrapper.de/emphasize-with-color-in-data-visualizations/) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} Lisa Charlotte Muth, ["A detailed guide to colors in data vis style guides"](https://blog.datawrapper.de/colors-for-data-vis-style-guides/). You can skim this—this is a good resource for future you. - {{< fa file-pdf >}} [Summary of CRAP graphic design principles](http://www.presentationzen.com/chapter6_spread.pdf) from *Presentation Zen* [@Reynolds:2008]. These principles are from Robin Williams' [*The Non-Designer's Design & Type Books*](https://www.amazon.com/Non-Designers-Design-Book-4th/dp/0133966151) [@Williams:2008], which you should really get if you're interested in doing anything design-related ever. Her stuff is life-changing. - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Typography in ten minutes](https://practicaltypography.com/typography-in-ten-minutes.html). The rest of the *Practical Typography* book is phenomenal and you'd be remiss if you didn't read the whole thing and bookmark it for life, but for now just read this quick summary. - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [Font Matrix – See & Pair Typefaces Like Never Before](https://pimpmytype.com/font-matrix/). In the videos, I mention that you should use contrasting font families, like choosing a sans serif and a serif font. But in reality, mixing fonts well is more complicated than that. The designer here presents something called the [Font Matrix](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=731-k8xSyqE) that will help you find good font combinations. - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["What's the Difference Between JPG, PNG, and GIF?"](https://gizmodo.com/5656669/whats-the-difference-between-jpg-png-and-gif) - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} ["File formats explained"](https://www.theglowstudio.com/file-formats-explained/) ### Possible questions to reflect on ::: {.callout-warning} #### This is not a required list! Remember, you don't need to answer all of these—or even any of them!
